other_tests.findings: Subnormal TSH response but normal prolactin response in both patients.
Normal duration of the QRS complex and a normal corrected QT interval in both patients.

Mildly affected distal motor latency prolongation and borderline sensory conduction velocity in the median nerve in the index patient; normal measurements in all other nerves; severe bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome in the father.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up neurophysiological examination after LT4 re-initiation showed normalization of the motor conduction of the median nerve in the index patient, while improvements were noted in the father but not normal.

other_tests.findings: BMD was normal in both patients: 0.911 g/cm² in the spine and 0.881 g/cm² in femoral head for the index patient; 1.110 g/cm² in spine and 1.209 g/cm² in femoral head for the father.
